messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] unusul kashira
messages.msgSnippet: Agreed on the helmet fitting details of course, but what the heck is with the composition?  I ve seen plenty of kabuto kashira, and the pointy ones
messages.messageBody:
Agreed on the helmet fitting details of course, but what the heck is with the "composition?" I've seen plenty of kabuto kashira, and the "pointy" ones (although mostly in books on the latter), but the construction of this one must have some specific use or meaning.

Jim



Cool Rich!
Where did you find this? It appears to me to be a hachimanza, which is
the hole at the top of a kabuto as G-money pointed out. The ring is a
something no wa can't remember the term seen at the back of a helmet.
May be some connection to Kyushu since they went in for "pointy"
kashira you could strike pressure points with.
BTW Kabuto-gane is another tern for the kashira...
-t

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] unusul kashira
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Tom, it s on Tokugawa Arts, http://sanmei.com/shop_e/en-us/dept_4.html  look for Ujshu Fujiwara Fuyuhiro ( 4th down ) at 14+K Ozy ( funny money ) I think
messages.messageBody:
Hi Tom, it's on Tokugawa Arts, http://sanmei.com/shop_e/en-us/dept_4.html look for Ujshu Fujiwara Fuyuhiro ( 4th down ) at 14+K Ozy ( funny money ) I think this is a ripper, wish I had 14K+ funny money.

Thanks for the thought's both to you and Dr R

Rich
